alert.note: Alert for Idaho Palouse (Idaho) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued August 29 at 3:15PM MDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Latah, northeastern Adams, northeastern Whitman, eastern Lincoln, south central Stevens and southwestern Spokane Counties through 245 PM PDT... At 215 PM PDT, Doppler radar was tracking strong thunderstorms along a line extending from 10 miles southwest of Davenport to 20 miles east of Ritzville to near Colfax. Movement was north at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor hail damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Colfax, Davenport, Potlatch, Palouse, Garfield, Albion, St. John, Sprague, Harrington, Endicott, Lamont, Mohler, Amber, Steptoe, Revere, Gravelles, Tyler, Mondovi, Thornton, and Rocklyn. This includes the following highways... Interstate 90 in Washington between mile markers 230 and 259. U.S. Highway 95 in Idaho between mile markers 355 and 362. U.S. Highway 2 in Washington between mile markers 243 and 261. U.S. Highway 195 in Washington between mile markers 26 and 59. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.
